getDataMeansToProcess

public java.util.List<DataMeans> getDataMeansToProcess(java.util.Date lastProcessed)
Gets the DataMeans objects that need to be processed- the ones that have lastProcessed values <= the one passed

Parameters:
lastProcessed - The date that is used to select DataMeans with
Returns:
A list of the results, or null if there was an error

setDataMeansProcessed

public boolean setDataMeansProcessed(DataMeans dm)
Sets the DataMeans object to processed. That is, the lastProcessed time will be set to the current time.

Parameters:
dm - The DataMeans object to update
Returns:
If the update was successful

createDataFusion

public boolean createDataFusion(DataFusion df)
Creates a DataFusion object if the (nodeID, DataStored_id) pair does not yet exist in the database.

Parameters:
df - The DataFusion object to create
Returns:
If the creation was successful, can fail for non fatal reasons (entry already exists)

getDataFusion

public DataFusion getDataFusion(int dataFusionID)
Gets a data fusion object by ID. This requires you to know the ID of the object in the table

Parameters:
dataFusionID - The ID in the SQL table of the datafusion object to be fetched
Returns:

cleanTables

public void cleanTables()
Deletes all records from tables that are related to articles, tags, data fusion, data indexing, etc. Used to enable unit testing

assignTags

public boolean assignTags(java.util.List<Node> nodes)
For a group of articles, adds the tags to the database and assigns those tags to those articles. Avoids duplicating tags for any of the inputed articles, but does not take into account any tags already in the database

Parameters:
nodes - The articles to assign tags to
Returns:
Indicates success or failure
